ji1d-these_glovesdonot.jcr:description: These gloves do not have hand warmers, but I have found with them that you don’t really need the warmers, and I consider myself one to get cold pretty easily, especially in my fingers and toes. The gloves are completely waterproof and have a great drawstring that helps to keep snow out and your body heat out.
ji1d-these_glovesdonot.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/536.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/19.0.1084.56 Safari/536.5

njct-if_you_don_twantto.jcr:description: If you don’t want to spend the extra money for gloves with a warmer pouch, I would suggest taking a pair of one-size-fits-all-liners (if you don’t already have some, they cost $2 just about anywhere) and wearing them under your gloves. This way, you can slide the hand warmer between the gloves and not risk irritating your hands. The only drawback is, of course, if you need to grip anything like ski poles the warmers will get in the way. Good luck!
